I'm kind of confused about some of the postings on here...
 
 Although this forum is very enlightening, I still don't understand why someone who isn't gay would spend so much time and energy fighting to keep gay rights an unreality. These same people seem to be the ones that use really hateful language and labeling techniques. I know things in here can get heated and there are bound to be some knee jerk angry reactions from time to time, but this is way beyond that.
 
 Now I know everyone has their opinion, but it seems like about 4 or 5 people in here spend a lot of time in here...almost to the point of obsession and post very unkind things about gays and lesbians.
 
 Am I the only one that is noticing this? It's really starting to upset me that my fellow humans have something against me loving another woman and vice versa for the past 25 years. 
 
 Is this the true nature of debate here? That gays are called horrible things in here and that's okay? Opposition and stating opinions is one thing, hating is another.
 
 Any one else here feel the same?

 Would you feel more comfortable if everyone in this forum had monolithic beliefs?
 To me, that wouldn't make frequenting the forum have any value. There's intellectual growth in disagreement. Anybody can rubberstamp someone else's opinion, but it takes a little thought to refute it.
 
 Statements like 
 
"I believe that homosexuality is natural...for a certain segment of the population. It's about 10 percent now. Homosexuality is as old as the written word. It's always been around in a small segment in every population."

 may appear reasonable or even factual to an unthinking participant, but to me, it pegs my BS meter. For instance, 10% of the population isn't gay. That's a commonly-stated, unsubstantiated claim. the real number is believed to be closer to 1% IIRC.
 There are lots of sites with various demographic breakdowns, but here's one for example:
 http://www.gaydemographics.org/USA/USA.htm
 
 As for the claim "natural", I guess it depends on what one considers "natural".
 To me, same-sex sex doesn't exactly look like it's natural. emoticon_confused 
 
 I do agree that we should debate our differences with civility and not resort to name-calling and personal attacks.
JakeCJB

Statements like 
 
 may appear reasonable or even factual to an unthinking participant, but to me, it pegs my BS meter. For instance, 10% of the population isn't gay. That's a commonly-stated, unsubstantiated claim. the real number is believed to be closer to 1% IIRC.
 There are lots of sites with various demographic breakdowns, but here's one for example:
 http://www.gaydemographics.org/USA/USA.htm

 
 Here is another site which looks at some studies done, showing various results...
 
 http://www.geocities.com/plusg1/facts_05.htm
 
 This was also from your link:
 
 http://www.thetaskforce.org/issues/census2000.htm
 
 It shows a very dramatic increase in same-sex households from state to state in the Census from 1990 to 2000. Of all places, there is a 2,590% increase in Wyoming, with huge increases in Arkansas and Alabama as well. It may be that people are more likely to report being in a gay or lesbian household to the government, as acceptance increases, especially in states, such as the ones I cited, which haven't been thought to be the most accepting in the past. We'll have to wait and see if those numbers continue to rise. My feeling is they will.
 
 Of course, the numbers really shouldn't matter. I can see why some people may be uncomfortable discussing being in a gay relationship with the U.S. government, which denies equality to those couples.

I thought people had the right to not be religious zealots. You have the right to spread your venemous hate here, offering nothing constructive, so obviously wrongdoing does have rights.
 
 
Stealing can never be a right. Adultery can never be a right. Nor can sodomy. Virtue has rights; vice does not. emoticon_ic

 
 The Taliban regime in Afghanistan had state enforcers of virtue and against vice too. What makes being gay a vice? I can't think of anything. What is the connection to stealing or to adultery?
JustineCredible

Population control emoticon_xhoho Good idea we need that emoticon_cool 
 
 
 Yes I am straight. I am not putting you down for being gay just dont understand it emoticon_confused

 
 Tucker: you are more than allowed to not understand it. That's as honest as I've heard so far. My question would be to you, are you willing to listen to those who would be glad to enlighten you? 
 
 I don't quite understand right-handed people, but I at least accept them and know that they are in the majority.
 The same goes for people who pick their noses in public, but the cool part is that I don't have to watch. 
 
 Homosexuals just are. The arguments as to their validity or otherwise are all quite moot. They are, they alway have been and always will be. They are in no way unable to reproduce, not to meantion that many actually do. 
 This would also extend to the fact that not all heterosexual encounters, let alone marriages result in offspring, and that not all offspring are created within a marriage. This doesn't even begin to touch on the multitude of factors which create single parent families. (Death, divorce, never marrying...etc) 
 This just puts a huge hole in the idea that marriage is for procreation. But those who are against homosexual marriages will always come up with some lame excuse as to why those factors are not of issue. 
 
 Then there is the claim that God never intended for gays to be let alone to marry and actually attempt to claim that somehow gays are a mistake. 
 Well if this were true then no one would be born left handed, red-haired, Albino, or with any form of birth defect. 
 
 I always love to laugh at the argument that if God intended for everyone to be gay it would only make the human species cease to exist. 
 Funny how gays actually do reproduce and therefore contintue the species just fine. 
 Again, not to mention the fact that not all heterosexuals are able to reproduce and hence those marriages or intertwinings would be against nature, but no one ever mentions that fact. 
 
 Of course there is always the standard fall back to the Bible and what it does or doesn't say about being gay. 
 What I have yet to hear here is the fact that the word "Homosexual" was only coined back in 1800 and therefore its impossible that the Bible says anything in the original texts about homosexuals or homosexuality. 
 Indeed it mentions many things about prostitution and child molestation. But please remember, the Bible also encourages slavery and promotes the idea that the world is flat, as well as the center of the universe. 
 All of those things have either been disproven or society has corrected it's views on inhumane treatment of fellow human beings.
 Ah, but it's still ok to treat Homosexuals as less than human? To insult, deny rights, beat and even murder them? 
 
 This leads me to the popular idea that homosexuality is somehow a choice. Why on earth would anyone Choose to be the victim of such abuse? I just can't phathom it. 
 And trust me, I never made such a choice. 
 
 The only choice I ever made was to stop attempting to live as society prescribed and to finally be honest.
